properties.text: The village hall is a memorial to the people from Stretton who were killed in the First World War. It is an old Canadian Army hut that was moved here from Leamington and has had the black and white entrance added. The picture is from 50 years ago, 1967
This is the old village grocery store, Borsleys. Everybody in fron is dressed up to Welcome Spring
This view of School Lane is probably about 110 years old. The large building in the centre, Oak House, was demolished and is now 2 bungalows
This photo is of the planting of the Lime Tree in 1883, so is more than 130 years old
This was known as Simpsons but is really Moor Farm. Th house dates from about ...
Brookside Stores has had many names over the years. Here it is Wilcox with plenty of people posing for the camera about 100 years ago
The Oak and Black Dog was once two separate pubs as you can see here with the black dog on the inn sign on the right
There were once 4 separate cottages by Brookside Store, including a Post Office. If you look closely at the building today, you can see where the doors once were
This picture is more than 100 years old and shows a much smaller Mutton than it is today
The house on the right is white and has avery large chimney. Look now and see what has changed! The car looks like one from the 1930s
This was the butcher which served villages all around Stretton as well as this village. It looks like the 1960s ....
